hints.content: Let's count how many days sold $14$ coupon books.

One weekday, Thursday, sold $\greenE{14}$ coupon books.

So, we place $1$ dot over $\greenE{14}$ on the number line.  

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/6d9d7efd3f991b72aaca3c290cac8a6238774214)
Now, let's graph the other measurements on the table.

Here is the completed line plot:

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/760c01f848e3a27c16b2aa14a991d8c8bda8fc6d)

question.content:
Randy is selling coupon books.  He's going to make a line plot of his sales data.  

Day | Coupon books sold
:-: | :-: | :-:
Monday | $17$
Tuesday | $15$
Wednesday | $17$
Thursday | $14$
Friday | $17$

**Graph the measurements from the table on the line plot.**   
*Click above the line plot to make dots for each of the measurements.*

[[â˜ƒ plotter 1]]
